column6: ɛʔ -> Standard Burmese,ɔʔ -> Arakanese,
/-ɪʔ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-aɪʔ/ -> Arakanese,e.g. စစ် ("genuine") and စိုက် ("plant") are both pronounced [saɪʔ] in Arakanese -> Notes,

/-ɪɴ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-aɪɴ/ -> Arakanese,e.g. ဥယျာဉ် ("garden"), from Standard Burmese [ṵ jɪ̀ɴ] → [wəjàɪɴ].,Irregular rhyme, with various pronunciations.,In some words, it is /-ɛɴ/ (e.g. ဝိညာဉ် "soul", from Standard Burmese [wèɪɴ ɲɪ̀ɴ] → [wḭ ɲɛ̀ɴ]).,In a few words, it is /-i -e/ (e.g. ညှဉ်း "oppress", from Standard Burmese [ɲ̥ɪ́ɴ] → [ɲ̥í, ɲ̥é]). -> Notes,
/ʃ-/ -> Standard Burmese,/hr-/ -> Arakanese,
/-wá/ -> Standard Burmese,/-ɔ́/ -> Arakanese,e.g. ဝါး ("bamboo") is [wá] in Standard Burmese, but [wɔ́] in Arakanese -> Notes,

/t- d-/ -> Standard Burmese,/r-/ -> Arakanese,e.g. The present tense particle တယ် ([dɛ̀]) corresponds with ရယ် ([rɛ̀]) in Arakanese,e.g. The plural particle တို့ ([do̰]) corresponds with ရို့ ([ro̰]) in Arakanese -> Notes,

/-i/ -> Standard Burmese,/-eɪɴ/ -> Arakanese,e.g. နီ ("red") is [nì] in Standard Burmese, but [nèɪɴ] in Arakanese,In some words, the rhyme is unchanged from the standard rhyme (e.g. မြေ "land", usually pronounced [mrì], not [mrèɪɴ], or အမိ "mother", usually pronounced [əmḭ], not [əmḛɪɴ],There are few exceptions where the nasal rhyme is /-eɪɴ-/ even without a nasal initial (e.g. သီ "thread", from Standard Burmese [θì] → [θèɪɴ]). -> Notes,
/ʃ-/ -> Standard Burmese,/h-/ -> Arakanese,Found in some words only -> Notes,
/-eɪɴ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-ɪɴ/ -> Arakanese,
/tɕʰ-/ -> Standard Burmese,/ʃ-/ -> Arakanese,Occasionally occurs (e.g. ချင် ("want") is [tɕʰɪ̀ɴ] in Standard Burmese, but [ʃɔ̀ɴ]~[tɕʰɔ̀ɴ] in Arakanese) -> Notes,
/-aɴ -ʊɴ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-ɔɴ/ -> Arakanese,ွန် is /-wɔɴ/ -> Notes,
/-aʔ -ʊʔ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-aʔ/ -> Arakanese,
/-ɪɴ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-ɔɴ/ -> Arakanese,
/-oʊɴ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-ʊɴ/ -> Arakanese,
ɛ -> Standard Burmese,e -> Arakanese,
/-u/ -> Standard Burmese,/-oʊɴ/ -> Arakanese,e.g. နု ("tender") is [nṵ] in Standard Burmese, but [no̰ʊɴ] in Arakanese -> Notes,
/-aɪʔ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-aɪʔ/ -> Arakanese,
/-i, -e, -ɛ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-e/ -> Arakanese,A few exceptions are pronounced /-aɪɴ/, like ကြည် ("clear"), pronounced [kràɪɴ] -> Notes,
/-w-/ -> Standard Burmese,/-rw-/ -> Arakanese,Occurs in some words (e.g. မြွေ ("snake") is [mwè] in Standard Burmese, but [mrwèɪɴ] in Arakanese) -> Notes,
/-aɪɴ/ -> Standard Burmese,/-aɪɴ/ -> Arakanese,
/-e/ -> Standard Burmese,/-i/ -> Arakanese,e.g. ချီ ("carry") and ချေ ("cancel") are pronounced [tɕʰì] and [tɕʰè] respectively in Standard Burmese, but merged to [tɕʰì] in Arakanese -> Notes,
